topic.title: HP Cloud OS Eve Service Overview

body.p: Eve is the HP Cloud OS infrastructure topology provisioning service. Eve allows you to:

ul.li: Provision TOSCA-based infrastructure topology designs (composite, hybrid, and distributed).
Separate topology creation and resource pool binding, for simpler, reusable topologies.
Integrate via a plug-in model with Cloud API's (e.g., OpenStack(R) Nova) for orchestrating provisioning.
Create and configure network services such as virtual load-balancers and configuration management services.

body.p: Eve also provides a logical execution container for flexible deployment of web-scale, stateless, thread controlled, non-blocking coarse-grained services.
This additional functionality in Eve allows you to:

ul.li: Retrieve the list of provisioning jobs
Retrieve information about a specific provisioning job

body.p: TOSCA is a standard way to describe the topology of applications along with dependent environments, services and artifacts inside a single service template. TOSCA standard enables each customer to deploy and manage topologies against the capabilities offered by any cloud provider, regardless of the customer's infrastructure or service model.
